704118f-a.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Dooley Street
704118f-a.text:
2261-2269 Emmons Ave., (foreground) north side, at and adjoining
Dooley Street, showing John Lindys parking space between same. Also
shown is Dooley Street, north from Emmons Ave. This street is one of
the oldest in Sheepshead Bay.
August 14, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
704118f-a.folder: Emmons Avenue & Dooley Street, Brooklyn, NY

704025f-a.title: Brooklyn: Dooley Street - Emmons Avenue
704025f-a.text:
Dooley Street, east side, at, adjoining and east of Emmons Ave.
Houses concerned are frame.
Juuly 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
704025f-a.folder: Dooley Street & Emmons Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704116f-a.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Dooley Street
704116f-a.text:
Emmons Ave., south side, between Dooley and East 23rd Streets. A
view of an old barge converted into an eating place on Sheepshead Bay.
In 1934 it was removed, and it is no longer used for that purpose. In the
extreme left background, is an old Hudson River Steam-boat, to be used in the
Bay as a dance palaoe, by a Sport Promoter. The boat one eveni u; in early
1933 foundered.
July 13, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
704116f-a.folder: Emmons Avenue & Dooley Street, Brooklyn, NY

704117f-c.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Dooley Street
704117f-c.text:
2253 to 2269 Emmons Avenue, north side, east from Dooley
Street to East 23rd Street, showing s group of frame houses.
Views 2 and 3 show how this tranquil residential area has changed
into a commercial district.
View 1: July 13, 1933
View 2: August 14, 1937
View 3: June 13, 1940
. L. Sperr
704117f-c.folder: Emmons Avenue & Dooley Street, Brooklyn, NY
